abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Accelerated Electricity Access (Rural) Expansion Project for
            Ethiopia is to establish a sustainable program for expanding
            access to electricity in rural communities, thus supporting
            broad-based economic development and helping alleviate
            poverty. The closing date for the project will be extended
            from June 30, 2011 until December 31, 2012. The credit is
            for 92.8 million SDR, from which 52.2 million SDRs have been
            disbursed. The project is recovering now from a slow start
            caused by procurement problems and a moratorium on
            connections, which was lifted in September 2010. Good
            progress has been made with 204 towns of 380 having been
            connected; 5 million compact fluorescent lamps distributed
            under the energy efficiency component, and much of the
            technical assistance has been rendered. The extension is
            necessary to allow sufficient time for completion of project
            activities which were delayed due to procurement problems
            and the connection moratorium declared as a result of the
            drought-induced power crisis. The borrower has an action
            plan in place to ensure timely completion of all outstanding
            activities under the project. The balance of towns will be
            electrified as per this plan.
